abstracts.cdata!:
The project objectives are to: increase
            real GDP growth to more than 4 percent per year by 1992;
            maintain inflation, measured by the GDP deflator, at around
            3 percent per year; reduce the current account balance
            relative to GDP; develop social services with an emphasis on
            access by the least favored groups. To achieve these
            objectives, the government will implement an integrated
            program of macroeconomic and structural reforms. At the
            macroeconomic level it will reduce the fiscal deficit
            relative to GDP. Specific structural reforms include: (a)
            improvements in public sector management through a detailed
            program of organizational reform of the three key economic
            ministries and the development of a civil service employment
            strategy over the medium term; (b) integration of social
            considerations in policy formulation through the development
            of new institutional mechanisms and technical instruments;
            (c) reform of the public enterprise sector through
            divestitures and the enactment and implementation of a legal
            framework giving greater autonomy to public enterprises; and
            (d) promotion of human resource development by rationalizing
            delivery systems and budgetary allocations. The foreign
            exchange provided under the credit will be used to finance
            essential imports.
